circumstances.circumstancesOfDisappearance:
Unknown. An officer at Reno / Tahoe International Airport discovered Palumbo in a restricted area of the facility shortly after 12:00 AM on April 26, 2000. She was believed to be disoriented possibly hallucinating at the time. The officer dropped her off at Reno Hilton Hotel and Casino at approximately 1:30 AM. There is no record of her checking in at that hotel.  
Palumbo's vehicle was discovered illegally parked and abandoned at the airport on April 27, one day after her disappearance. The majority of her personal belongings were found inside the car, along with her cellular phone and her purse, which contained $600 in cash.
The owner of the Silver Dollar Casino in Elko, Nevada claimed that Palumbo was inside her establishment in December 2000, eight months after Palumbo disappeared. The owner told authorities that the woman became nervous when she saw a man peering through the bar's window during the evening. According to the owner, the woman then departed from the Silver Dollar Casino with another female. Authorities have been unable to confirm if the unidentified woman in the establishment was indeed Palumbo. Foul play is suspected in her case.

vehicles.comment: Her vehicle, which contained all of her personal belongings, was later found abandoned at Reno/Tahoe International Airport.

circumstances.circumstancesOfDisappearance:
John Hahn left his home in San Diego, CA (where he was a long time resident) for Laughlin, NV on June 10, 1989.  Prior to leaving for Nevada, John dropped his wife off at the airport.  He was reportedly carrying a large amount of cash with him. 

On the weekend of the 4th of July, 1989, witnesses indicated having seen John Scott Hahn at a Laughlin convenience store where he placed a phone call. 

He was not heard from again since that time.

clothingAndAccessoriesArticles.description: Bifocal glasses with "Photo-Gray" variable tint lenses and gold colored metal frame.

vehicles.comment: On July 21, 1989, Jean Hahn received a phone call from the Laughlin, NV substation of the Las Vegas Metro Police, informing her that her husband's car had been found, abandoned, in the desert south of Laughlin.  The car had gotten stuck in deep soft sand, and had been in that location for a number of days, with windows rolled down, a full fuel tank, John Hahn's packed suitcase in back seat, and evidence that the radiator/cooling system had been recently filled up and treated with a cooling system “stop leak” compound.  The A/C system was inoperative.  The car had to be winched out of the soft sand.  It was taken to the local impounding yard.

physicalDescription.headHairDescription: Graying brown hair, high forehead/hair line

physicalFeatureDescriptions.description: wears dentures

Hahn has a vertically scar of about 12 inches in length on the center of his chest from a surgical implant. (an artificial repair made to his aorta, due to an aneurysm). He also has a 2" scar on the left side of his chin/cheek.
Hahn is left handed, and usually wears his wristwatch on the right wrist.

At 7:45 pm on the evening of his disappearance, Roy Frisch left his home walking to the Majestic Theater, where he watched the movie, Gallant Lady.  After the movie, he was seen by a friend at the corner of Sierra and Court Streets.  Roy Frisch never made it home and he has not been seen since.  He is believed to have met with foul play.

     The family indicates that they received a phone call from the M/P in April 1994, the believe she was calling from an unknown number in Las Vegas NV. The family filed an additional M/P report at the Las Vegas Metropolitan Police Department in Las Vegas NV. The additional report was filed in Las Vegas on October 3rd, 2007.

circumstances.circumstancesOfDisappearance: Allan was last seen on 06/04/1969 while out boating on Pyramid Lake.  News reports state that Allan noticed the boat started drifting away from shore when he climbed aboard to attempt to save the watercraft from floating away, but he did not know how to operate the vessel.  A large storm producing severe wind gusts was in the area at the time and quickly swept the boat out, away from shore.  The 16-foot boat was located approximately 2 miles west from an area known as Hells Kitchen the day after the initial incident (9.33-miles away from the last location Allan was seen), but Allan was not located.  The search continued for another day after the vessel was located, and was ended on June 6, 1969.

circumstances.circumstancesOfDisappearance:
The Reno Police Department and Humboldt County Sheriff's Office are asking for the public's assistance in locating a missing person. Patrick Carnes (86 years old) who was last seen alive in the area of Wells, Nevada on Wednesday, April 13, 2011. He was traveling to Reno, Nevada from Toledo, Ohio. His car was later located abandoned off of I-80 between Golconda and Battle Mountain, in Humboldt County. Carnes was traveling with his canine companion Lucky. Lucky is a large 80-100 pound brown mixed breed male dog.

Patrick and his dog, Lucky, were heading home to Reno when they both mysteriously vanished on April 13, 2011.

In early April 2011, Patrick Carnes traveled from his home in Reno, Nev., to visit family in Ohio. There, he looked at retirement homes where he could spend his golden years.

Patrick, a World War II vet who served in the Solomon Islands, was a proud, active man, with no signs of slowing down.

On April 12, he packed up his dark green Subaru wagon and drove back to Reno with his best friend, a slightly overweight, 100-pound Akita/mixed-breed dog named "Lucky."

The following night, just after Patrick and Lucky entered the state of Nevada, a trooper pulled Patrick over for not changing lanes appropriately near the town of Wells. After speaking briefly with the officer, Patrick got off with a warning and continued his late-night trek across the state via westbound I-80.

Though they were only about a six hour drive from Reno, Patrick and Lucky never made it there.

The next morning, Patrick's car was found abandoned in sage brush, a good distance from the highway in rural Winnemucca.

When investigators came upon Patrick's vehicle, they found no signs of foul play. The car was a good distance from the road, and its front end was facing the interstate. There was no evidence leading investigators to believe Patrick and Lucky were abducted, but they can't rule anything out.

After doing extensive air and ground searches of the vast, wide open, Nevada desert, cops in Humboldt County have come up completely empty-handed. There hasn't been a single sighting of the missing duo.

When Patrick was pulled over in Wells, he told the trooper he was going to get a room in nearby Elko that night, but there's no record of him ever doing so.

What happened overnight remains a mystery to investigators, and they need your help to piece the clues together.

In the middle of the night, every night, I-80 is dominated by big rigs. Detectives believe a trucker might have seen what happened to Patrick and Lucky, but no one has come forward as of yet.

"Some trucker saw an old man with a dog," Humboldt County Undersheriff Curtiss Kull said.

Consequently, investigators would like to make a plea to anyone -- specifically long-haul truck drivers -- who may have driven on I-80 between Wells and Winnemucca, and saw Patrick and Lucky between the late evening hours of April 13 through the early morning hours of April 14.

If you know anything about the bizarre disappearance of Patrick Carnes, or his best friend, Lucky, you've got to call our toll-free Hotline right away at 1-800-CRIME-TV. Remember: You can remain anonymous.

@ Info Posted on America's Most Wanted Website.

circumstances.circumstancesOfDisappearance:
Nan Dixon was last seen in Grass Valley, California on September 21, 1978. She was leaving for a nearly three-hour trip to visit family in Seven Troughs, Nevada, near Lovelock. She never arrived at her destination and her family reported her missing a short time later.

In November 1982, Nan Dixon's Datsun was found by coyote hunters in a ravine below the main road of the Seven Troughs turnoff. It had been discovered in an area that had been previously searched from the air and by ground. The car appeared to have been deliberately driven over a rocky road and into the ravine. Tire tracks could be seen where it left the road and traversed down into the gulch. The tires were badly scuffed from having been driven over the rocky road, but otherwise held air and were considered to be in reasonably good condition. The car also contained a half tank of gasoline.

vehicles.comment: In November 1982, the car was found by coyote hunters in a ravine below the main road of the Seven Troughs turnoff. It had been discovered in an area that had been previously searched from the air and by ground. The car appeared to have been deliberately driven over a rocky road and into the ravine. Tire tracks could be seen where it left the road and traversed down into the gulch. The tires were badly scuffed from having been driven over the rocky road, but otherwise held air and were considered to be in reasonably good condition. The car also contained a half tank of gasoline.

David was working in Las Vegas, Nevada when he left for Salt Lake City, Utah on 05/09/1984.  His vehicle was found abandoned on 05/23/1984 in Littlefield, Arizona near a desert area. His belongings were found inside the vehicle and his keys were found on the ground outside of the vehicle. He has not been seen or heard from since.

Juan came to St. George to sell some property in preparation of moving to Orem, Utah.  Juan was supposed to return to Orem on November 13, 2019 but did not show up.   Juan contacted his ex-wife and told her that he was going to Tijuana.  In the past Juan has advised he was going to go back to his home country of El Salvador to die.  It is unknown if this was his intention.  It was confirmed Juan took a shuttle from St. George, Utah to Las Vegas, Nevada on November 14, 2019.  On November 15, 2019, Juan's cell phone was pinged.  It returned showing his last known location was Las Vegas.  His cell phone has not been on since this last ping.

circumstances.circumstancesOfDisappearance:
Aidan is known to have traveled from California to Utah on April 26. He then drove back to Nevada and stayed the night in Wells, checking out of a hotel room at approximately 6:23 a.m. April 27. He traveled south on U.S. Highway 93 and parked his pickup truck on the shoulder near mile marker 23. At approximately 8:50 a.m. on April 27 a Nevada State Police trooper found the vehicle abandoned.

The Sheriff’s Office was notified of the situation on April 28, and began a search for Aidan. His tracks were located leaving the area where the pickup was abandoned, and he was tracked for more than 10 air miles. He has not been located despite multiple search efforts.

circumstances.circumstancesOfDisappearance:
Gabriel Vincent was last seen near the end of 1979.  He had been renting storage space at on Teco Avenue. A friend of his went missing in February 1980 and has also not been heard from since.  

Gabriel Vincent didn't renew his driver's license when it expired in 1980. A check of every state's department of motor vehicles failed to find a license for him anywhere.  

The missing person also never picked up his last check from work. 

Given the circumstances, it is believed that Gabriel Vincent has met with foul play, yet his body has never been recovered.

A tip was submitted to PD  that suggested his body north on U.S. 95 toward Indian Springs and buried it in the desert near the turnoff for Mount Charleston in November 1979, however nothing was found.

Richard left the State of NJ in July 2018 and proceeded west towards Nevada.  The last contact with his family was via text on July 16, 2018.  On November 25, 2018, Richard's family received a telephone call from Washoe County Sheriff's Office stating that Richard's vehicle was found abandoned/parked on top of a mountain overpass.  The location in which it was found is normally frequented by hikers, but was closed at the time due to inclement winter weather.  A cellphone ping confirmed Richard's whereabouts to be in the same location as the vehicle with a date/time of November 13, 2018 at 1852 hours.  During their subsequent Missing Person Investigation, Washoe County Sheriff's Department located video surveillance from the Nugget Casino in Sparks, Nevada from November 13, 2018 where Richard checked out of the hotel earlier in the day.  It is believed that Richard is in the area of Mount Rose Summit in Nevada.

circumstances.circumstancesOfDisappearance: Casey got on his motorcycle and drove off.  There has been no contact until a tow company sent a certified letter saying they towed his motorcycle.  The motorcycle was parked with his helmet near Derby Dam near the Truckee River and had been sitting for several days. His bank account has not been accessed. He had no cell phone when he went missing.

circumstances.circumstancesOfDisappearance: M/P, 70 years of age last seen at the residence she shared with a friend. The M/P was found to be missing along with her vehicle. The vehicle was located in a desert area Southeast of Las Vegas. The vehicle was impounded & processed by Las Vegas Metro P.D. M/P has not been seen or heard from since.

vehicles.comment: Vehicle was subsequently recovered in the desert area Southeast of Las Vegas. Vehicle located approximately 2 miles South of the Boulder HWY / Searchlight Turnoff & approximately 4 miles West of the Searchlight HWY.

circumstances.circumstancesOfDisappearance: Donald Whalen drove a friend from Las Vegas, NV to Fallon, NV on 9/3/1995. Donald Whalen left the same day to return to Las Vegas, NV. Whalen was scheduled for work the following afternoon and never showed. On 9/11/95, Whalen's vehicle was located in a remote location, about 12 miles north of Fallon. The vehicle was stuck in the sand. An extensive search was completed around the time Whalen went missing, however, Whalen has not been seen or heard from since.

clothingAndAccessoriesArticles.description: Gold ER of footprint, necklace with pendant, watch

circumstances.circumstancesOfDisappearance: Barry Stephenson was last seen on around 1215 hours getting into a Capital Cab outside the Carson Nugget. The Capitol Cab stated that they had dropped him off at the Greyhound bus stop in Sparks and he said he was wanting to go to Arizona.

clothingAndAccessoriesArticles.description: Barry was last seen on video wearing a cowboy hat and carrying a large bag with a dark coat on and pants.

physicalFeatureDescriptions.description: Barry has a long white beard.
